channel.title: Mad Kane Political Satire, Song Parodies, Legal Humor, and News Related Limericks from MadKane.com
channel.description: Humorist, Political Satirist, and Recovering Lawyer Madeleine Begun Kane brings you the Mad Kane Podcast: Political Humor, Legal Humor, Commentary on the News, Song Parodies, and Limericks from MadKane.com

image.title: Madeleine Begun Kane's Humor: MadKane.com
image.description: Mad Kane Mocks The Powerful 24/7 Through Satire, Song Parodies, Limericks, And Humor Columns

item.title: Mad Kane Reads The AP, So You Don't Have To - Commentary and Song Parody
item.description: Commentary and song parody that mocks an AP article that paints Democrats as scary liberals

item.title: Ode To Kenny Boy Song Parody
item.description: Song Parody to Celebrate Ken Lay's Conviction

item.title: Ode To The Signing Statement and Other Limericks
item.description: Limericks about Bush's stealth signing statements, Colin Powell, and FEMA

item.title: White House Shakeup Song Parody and Limericks -- MadKane.com
item.description: Song parody and two limericks about the so-called White House shakeup

item.title: It's Surely Snowing In Hell (Dubai Seaport Humor) -- MadKane.com
item.description: Commentary, limerick and poem about the UAE Dubai seaport deal

item.title: Faking Contrition Song Parody -- MadKane.com
item.description: Song parody about the Dick Cheney's hunting accident and the media's reaction.

item.title: Don't Hunt With Dick Cheney Song Parody -- MadKane.com
item.description: Song parody about the Dick Cheney's hunting accident

item.title: Cheney Misfires -- Big Time! and Other Political Verse -- MadKane.com
item.description: Commentary, limericks and other verse about the Dick Cheney's hunting accident, Congress, and George Bush

item.title: Ode To Press Hypocrisy and Other Oprah Winfrey / James Frey Limericks and Verse -- MadKane.com
item.description: Limericks and other verse about the Oprah Winfrey / James Frey brouhaha and George Bush

item.title: Personal Poems For Some Sam Alito Filibuster Holdouts -- MadKane.com
item.description: Personal verse for four of the Sam Alito filibuster holdouts: Senators Byrd, Landrieu, Akaka, and Nelson

item.title: Ode To Takeout Song Parody Lyrics and Who? Me? Cook? -- MadKane.com
item.description: In a departure from MadKane.com's customary poltical and legal humor, today's podcast features food and cooking related humor, including a limerick about being a bad cook and a song parody about addiction to takeout menus.

item.title: If Not Now, Then When? -- Sam Alito In Verse
item.description: Political commentary and several poems about Judge Sam Alito's Supreme Court nomination and hearings.

item.title: Spying and Lying -- 5 Limericks
item.description: Political commentary and five limericks called "A Bush Pioneer Who's Named Jack," "George Bush Says His Spying Is Cool," "Consultation Dubya Style," "Did The White House On Christiane Spy?" and "Preacher Pat:"

item.title: Say Goodbye To Tom DeLay -- Song Parody -- Sing to "Yesterday"
item.description: Song Parody inspired by Jack Abramoff's guilty plea and its impact on Tom DeLay

item.title: Auld Lang Impeachment -- Song Parody
item.description: Song Parody inspired by the need to impeach President George Bush and VP Richard Cheney

item.title: Bill O'Reilly's Faux War On Christmas Song Parody
item.description: Song Parody inspired by Bill O'Reilly's claim that there's a war against Christmas

item.title: Randy Cunningham Limericks; Ode to Bob Woodward
item.description: Commentary, limericks, and humor about Randy Cunningham, Bob Woodward, and Joe Wilson

item.title: Wacky-Off: Jean Schmidt vs. Pat Robertson
item.description: Commentary, limericks, and humor about Ohio's Jean Schmidt, Rev. Pat Robertson, and home squirrel invasions.

item.title: Yet Another White House Leak: Ethics Class Humor
item.description: Commentary, satirical White House memo, and a limerick about the White House ethics classes and Harry Reid's closing down the Senate.

item.title: Four Sam Alito Limericks
item.description: Commentary and four limericks inspired Supreme Court nominee Samuel Alito.

item.title: Fitzmas Madness
item.description: Commentary and a poem inspired by the Valerie Plame outing investigation and pre-indictment jitters.
